nodes.bodyText:
Current UTs test the happy path. Should add more UTs to cover the sad path.
For example, what is supposed to happen if a hacker tries to send some random Ip and Mac addresses to NodeManager? The correct behavior is to reject those calls.
Don't see necessary verification for NodeManager.

Didn't see the response so I am assuming that you are still working on these UTs.
A good discussion about UT handling on the Alcor channel on Slack today. Please take a look.
More UTs for sad pass and exception handling cases.
Looks better now. Let us keep looking to see if any more cases might be missed.
We should do all necessary verification before persisting the states to database.
Exception for validation and functions to validate data are added.

Any reason that we want to pass InetAddress as an parameter?
The object is quite complicated.
{
"host_info": {
"local_ip": {
"address": [
"string"
],
"anyLocalAddress": true,
"canonicalHostName": "string",
"hostAddress": "string",
"hostName": "string",
"linkLocalAddress": true,
"loopbackAddress": true,
"mcglobal": true,
"mclinkLocal": true,
"mcnodeLocal": true,
"mcorgLocal": true,
"mcsiteLocal": true,
"multicastAddress": true,
"siteLocalAddress": true
},
"mac_address": "string",
"node_id": "string",
"node_name": "string",
"server_port": 0,
"veth": "string"
}
}
IP address type is changed to String
Regarding old comments left for PR (#185), are these configuration related to the upload file API to limit the file uploading? If so, those are good configuration. Otherwise, completely remove them.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+#ignite configuration
+ignite.host=localhost
+ignite.port=10800
+ignite.key-store-path=keystore.jks
+ignite.key-store-password=123456
+ignite.trust-store-path=truststore.jks
+ignite.trust-store-password=123456
+## MULTIPART (MultipartProperties)
+# Enable multipart uploads
+#spring.servlet.multipart.enabled=true

nodes.bodyText: Yes, that is the purpose the configuration. It is currently removed.

nodes.bodyText:
A good example of exceptions handling:
https://github.com/futurewei-cloud/alcor/pull/180/files#diff-9c86731ca636830c35d171bddafb3ed2
services/port_manager/src/main/java/com/futurewei/alcor/portmanager/exception/AllocateIpAddrException.java
We should identify various specific exceptions that a services might throw, and handle them in different catch blocks (although using a generic exception is easy, it leaves headaches for operation people to see the service logs as it is too generic).
I agree and added more exceptions.
Comments are very good. Let us add more to elsewhere, especially for Controller, Services and Repo codes.
They are reverted.
Sorry, do you mean you remove the comments?
The configuration was added again. Sorry for confusion. I will commit soon.

Okay, we are talking about different things. This refers to the comments you made to the method "findItem" and "findAllItems". This is a very good practice so let us practice it more often for other important methods in Controller, Services and Repo.
This hides the exception on the service level which Controller don't have visibility. Please check the good example in the comments above related to exception handling.
I agree. More exceptions are added.

Maybe we could use Logger to give a bit more details.
The current handling does not differentiate exceptions.
